item.title: Disgraced Matt Lauer 'is kicked out of his $36million Hamptons home by his furious Dutch wife' following sex allegation shame
item.description: Annette Roque, who Lauer has been married to for 19 years, forced him out of the estate where they live with their three children over the weekend, according to Page Six.
item.content:encoded:
Matt Lauer has reportedly been kicked out of his $36 million Hamptons compound by his wife. 

Annette Roque, who Lauer has been married to for 19 years, forced him out of the estate where they live with their three children over the weekend, according to Page Six. 

A source close to the family said Lauer is staying at a home nearby so he can be close to the two kids who still live at home. His oldest son attends a boarding prep school.

This move comes months after multiple women came forward to accuse the disgraced anchor of inappropriate sexual behavior. 

Then, just this past week, Lauer's former co-anchor Ann Curry spoke about her time on Today for the first time, saying their was a culture of verbal sexual harassment on the NBC morning show.

Scroll down for video 

In addition to his North Haven compound, Lauer and his wife own a 40-acre horse farm in Water Mill and a 25-acre Sag Harbpor estate which thyey have been trying to sell for $14.9 million after first putting the house on the market for $18 million in 2016.

Roque lives in the North Haven home with the couple's three children, while Lauer would travel out for the weekends and spend the week in an Upper East Side apartment.

That residence is in the same building as the penthouse where disgraced banker Bernie Madoff lived with his wife Ruth.  

This all changed when he was fired from Today, and for the past two months he has been living with his family in North Haven. 

Since the allegations of sexual misconduct broke Lauer has been working tirelessly to save his marriage, a source told Page Six.

Roque is reportedly being 'very cold.' 

Lauer's representatives have not yet said if the couples are formally separated, but Roque was seen meeting with divorce lawyers in New York last month. 

Lauer was fired from his $25million-a-year gig at Today in late November after he was accused of inappropriate sexual conduct in the workplace. Shortly after he released a statement saying he was 'truly sorry'.

He was accused of sexually harassing an unnamed former intern while they covered the 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia. After the initial allegations a number of women came forward with similar allegations. 

The scandal could be the last straw for Roque - who filed for divorce from Lauer back in 2006. 

At the time she cited 'mental abuse, extreme mental and emotional distress, humiliation, torment and anxiety.' 

But she eventually withdrew the filing when he offered her a post-nuptial agreement and millions of dollars.
item.dc:abstract: Matt Lauer has allegedly been kicked out of his Hamptons home by his wife, months after multiple women came forward to accuse the disgraced anchor of inappropriate sexual behavior. Annette Roque, who Lauer has been married to for 19 years, forced him out of the estate where they live with their three children over the weekend, according to Page Six. A source close to the family said Lauer is staying at a home nearby so he can be close to the two kids who still live at home. His oldest son attends a boarding prep school. Lauer was fired from his $250million yearly gig at The Today Show in late November after he was accused of inappropriate sexual conduct in the workplace. Shortly after he released a statement saying he was 'truly sorry'.

item.title: Real Madrid star Cristiano Ronaldo gets caught mocking rival Lionel Messi to mascot in tunnel before convincing victory over Deportivo La Coruna
item.description: Messi duly responded to Ronaldo's jibe by scoring twice himself in Barcelona's comfortable victory over Real Betis to take him to 25 goals in all competitions for the season.
item.content:encoded:
Cristiano Ronaldo was caught on camera mocking his rival Lionel Messi to a mascot in the tunnel before Real Madrid's 7-1 victory over Deportivo La Coruna on Sunday. 

Standing in the Bernabeu tunnel before the La Liga fixture, a young mascot attempted to strike up conversation with the Madrid star.

'For me, you are the best player in the world and Messi...' said the youngster before being cut off by the Portugal forward.

Scroll down for video 

'Is bad', Ronaldo cheekily finished the mascot's sentence. His Madrid team-mates responded with a chuckle.

Ronaldo and Messi have been in constant competition, going head-to-head to earn the 'best player in the world' tag for the past decade.

They have won five Ballon d'Ors each in that time but it was the Madrid forward who staked claim to the throne last time out by picking up the gong in Paris last month.

There is a semblance of truth to the argument that because of that victory Ronaldo currently holds the honour.

But the 32-year-old has endured a tough campaign so far. He did manage to get back to scoring ways by netting a brace in the 7-1 demolition job of Deportivo.

But Messi duly responded to Ronaldo's jibe by scoring twice himself in Barcelona's comfortable victory over Real Betis to take him to 25 goals in all competitions for the season.

The Madrid forward's two goals took him to six La Liga goals in 15 games - a tally that is considerably low by his standards. His woes have coincided with Madrid's domestic struggles, too.

They are 19 points behind rivals Barcelona and are in a battle to finish in the top four. The victory on the weekend did relieve some pressure on boss Zinedine Zidane, though.

'It's always great and a positive feeling to win, netting seven goals at home,' said Zidane after the game.

'It's not every day you get seven goals at the Bernabeu so we're thrilled with that today. We were hungry to get a result like this and now we want a repeat performance on Wednesday and next Saturday.'
item.dc:abstract: Cristiano Ronaldo was caught on camera mocking his rival Lionel Messi to a mascot in the tunnel before Real Madrid's 7-1 victory over Deportivo La Coruna on Sunday. Standing in the Bernabeu tunnel before the La Liga fixture, a young mascot attempted to strike up conversation with the Madrid star. 'For me, you are the best player in the world and Messi...' said the youngster before being cut off by the Portugal forward.

item.title: 'It's big in Hollywood but no one admits it': Human Ken Doll Rodrigo Alves reveals he had his ribs removed so his beloved blazers would fit him again and has shrunk his waist to 20"
item.description: He garnered headlines after becoming the first man to have four ribs removed in a £28,000 procedure.
item.content:encoded:
He garnered headlines after becoming the first man to have four ribs removed in a £28,000 procedure. 

And Human Ken Doll Rodrigo Alves, 34, talked about the reasons for the procedure during an interview on This Morning on Tuesday. 

He said: 'I have had to do this so I don’t have to get my blazers refitted as they were all too tight. Now they all fit again and my tailor will be out of a job.

Scroll down for video 

'I always put my outfits on social media like you Holly [Willoughby] and now I have nearly a 20 inch waist, so I am very happy.'

Talking about the rib removal, which was performed in LA by Dr Michael K. Obeng, Roddy said that he was careful to make sure his operation was as safe as possible.

He said: 'It can be dangerous for your organs. I had the 11th and 12th ribs removed and there is not much use for them. They did not cut too close to the spine.' 

'I visited three different doctors, had all my tests and exams done. I had wanted six ribs to be removed but they could only do four, but I am very happy.

'It is not a very normal procedure I am the only man in the world to have had it done. It’s big in Hollywood, but people don’t talk about it openly like me.'

Gender-fluid Rodrigo was keen to dispel any idea that he was not in control of his actions and says he's happy to be different to other people.

He said: 'It’s been a very long journey. I like the way I look, I like to stand out, I don’t do it to look normal.

'I have had 10 nose jobs my nose reconstructed using my rib. I can breathe better but it’s still not perfect.

'I always say do your research – I have made my mistakes, I was very young when I started it. Talk to your family.' 

Rodrigo did admit that he felt insecure about his looks from a young age, saying that children in school were unkind to him. 

He said: 'I was bullied by my appearance – the boys at school made me aware by physically bullying me.

'When I came to the UK I wanted to change my life – get educated and re-invent myself. 

'I do not encourage others to do this but I am very happy. This has changed my life from water to wine.

'My advice is don’t do what I have done. I didn’t need 60 [surgeries], I might have only needed 10.'  

The TV star wore bright pink trousers and a white blazer with a black shirt under a corset that he is wearing to help him shrink further.

He posed backstage with his old ribs in a glass jar as he proudly posed for snaps. 

And Twitter went wild for his appearance on the show with viewers largely loving Rodrigo's personality but some unsure if he had gone too far. 

However, many people wrote that as long as he is happy, then it is his choice. 

Rodrigo is due to fly to New York tomorrow where he is scheduled to appear on a host of television shows.

And Human Ken Doll Rodrigo Alves, 34, talked about the reasons for the procedure during an interview on This Morning on Tuesday. He said: 'I have had to do this so I don’t have to get my blazers refitted as they were all too tight. Now they all fit again and my tailor will be out of a job.

item.mi:shortTitle: Human Ken Doll Rodrigo Alves talks rib removal

item.title: Sophie Turner 'will complete work on Game of Thrones finale before she plans her wedding to Joe Jonas'... as co-star Maisie Williams reveals she'll be a bridesmaid
item.description: Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner and singer Joe Jonas have put a pin in wedding plans until after the end of final season of the hit HBO show is made
item.content:encoded:
They announced their engagement in October with an intimate Instagram post of their hands intertwined, simply captioned 'I said yes'

But that might be as far as Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner, 21, and singer Joe Jonas, 28, get before the end of final season of the hit HBO show is made as she's reportedly put a pin in plans while the fantasy drama is being filmed.

Best friend and GoT co-star Maisie Williams, 20, wasn't shy about discussing her BFFs future nuptials - even excitedly revealing that's she's already been made a bridesmaid.

Scroll down for video 

Chatting to the Radio Times, Maisie - who plays Arya Stark, the sister of Sophie's Sansa Stark - said any wedding plans have been put on hold while the cameras are still rolling on season eight. 

She said: 'We're waiting until the season is done until we get into any of that, but I think she's already letting her little heart wander and imagine.'

When quizzed about whether or not she'll make the wedding party cut, Maisie jubilantly replied 'Oh, already got it' 

 'It's very, very exciting,' she continued. 'It's kind of bizarre, though!'

Maisie and Sophie have been tight-knit friends since the early days of Game of Thrones, even getting matching tattoos in September - inking their skin with the date they both discovered they had secured their roles.

As for any imminent wedding bells, the DNCE frontman and his X-men beauty may have to wait for a year to start making preparations, as the last season of the fantasy mega-hit is set to air in 2019. 

Sophie and Joe have been dating since November 2016, when they were spotted cosying up at a Kings of Leon concert in the Netherlands.  

The pair are famously tight-lipped about their romance, but Sophie did address how difficult it is to enjoy a relationship in the public eye.

Discussing how much attention they get as a couple, she told Marie Claire in July: 'You do feel like you're living in a fishbowl. It's frustrating [that] it's the most mundane things that make the news - how boring!'
item.dc:abstract: They announced their engagement in October with an intimate Instagram post of their hands intertwined, simply captioned 'I said yes' But that might be as far as Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner and singer Joe Jonas get before the end of final season of the hit HBO show is made as she's reportedly put a pin in plans while the fantasy drama is being filmed. Best friend and GoT co-star Maisie Williams, 20, wasn't shy about discussing her BFFs future nuptials - even excitedly revealing that's she's already been made a bridesmaid.
item.dc:creator: Jason Chester
item.mi:shortTitle: Sophie Turner holds of wedding planning until after GoT

item.title: Off their trolleys! Shocking moment a Tesco worker kicks at a customer who then charges at him with a huge STICK in row 'over a stolen Pot Noodle'
item.description: This shocking footage shows a Tesco employee 'kick out' at customer who then retaliates by charging at him with a huge stick outside a branch of the store in Hackney, London.
item.content:encoded:
This shocking footage shows a Tesco employee 'kick out' at an aggressive customer who then retaliates by charging at him with a huge stick, in what a witness claimed was a row about a stolen Pot Noodle.     

The video shows a row that starts with a tug of war over a backpack outside a branch of the supermarket in Hackney Road, London. 

Two customers are then pulled back into the store by staff. However, seconds later they reemerge onto the street. 

Harry Anderson, who filmed the video, said one of the customers then threw what looked like a Pot Noodle into the store.

The altercation continues down the road as staff follow the retreating customers and heated words are exchanged. 

One of the Tesco employees then appears to kick out at the customer. 

The customer retaliates by swinging his backpack at the worker before another employee runs in swinging his arms at the shopper.

Moments later the bag is flung into the air by the shop worker who kicked out.

The brawl then appears to calm down as the customers leave the area.

However, the man soon returns with a huge stick and charges at the Tesco workers chasing them back into the store.

They run for safety and the customer smashes the stick against the exterior of the shop.

Mr Anderson, who watched the whole thing unfold while on his lunch break on January 16, said he believed the incident may have started with an accusation of shoplifting, although there is no evidence that any crime was committed.

He said of the violent encounter: 'I don't think the Tesco worker should have reacted that way at all.'

'They showed absolutely no respect for each other – no matter who the person is you can't do that.' 

A Tesco spokesperson said: 'We're aware of this incident and are investigating what's happened.'
item.dc:abstract: This shocking footage shows a Tesco employee 'kick out' at customer who then retaliates by charging at him with a huge stick. Footage shows a tug of war begin over a backpack outside the supermarket branch which ends with the customers being pulled back into the Hackney branch of the store.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Dean
item.mi:shortTitle: Row erupts as Tesco worker kicks at customer who chases him with STICK

item.title: 'He is going to kill me, don’t reply': Haunting text 'kidnap victim sent to her mother after builder, 33, raped her then said "you've got ten minutes to live" after killing his 20-year-old niece'
item.description: The surviving victim desperately tried to raise the alarm after Mujahid Arshid, 33, kidnapped her and 20 year-old Celine Dookhran (pictured), the Old Bailey heard.
item.content:encoded:
A woman kidnapped by a man accused of brutally killing his 20-year-old niece sent a chilling text to her mother saying 'he is going to kill me' after he allegedly raped her.  

The surviving victim desperately tried to raise the alarm after Mujahid Arshid, 33, kidnapped her and 20 year-old Celine Dookhran, the Old Bailey heard.

Arshid is accused of murdering Miss Dookhran and stuffing her body inside a chest-high freezer at a disused £1.5million six-bedroom house he was working at in Kingston-upon-Thames, Surrey.

Prosecutors claim Vincent Tappu, 28, was also involved in the ‘premeditated’ attack on the two Muslim girls.

The other woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was raped and slashed with a knife as Arshid told her: ‘You’ve got ten minutes to live.’

Arshid is said to have been inspired by one of Britain’s most notorious killers, the acid-bath murderer John George Haigh.

Giving evidence, the surviving woman described how she was woken in July last year by a man standing over her wearing pyjamas.

She said: ‘He had a balaclava on he was wearing his glasses and you could see his nose coming through.’

The witness told how their captors later changed clothes and took off their balaclavas once they arrived at the house in Coombes Lane West, Kingston.

She said she managed to find a mobile phone at the property and sent messages to her boyfriend and mother - but warned them not to call the number back.

The last message she sent at 4.41pm to her mother read: ‘He is going to kill me, don’t reply.’

In her taped police interview - while she still lay in b ed at St George’s Hospital - she described how she tried to persuade her captor to let her call her university as she had a deadline.

She said she hoped he would ‘nip out’ so she could call the police but he was ‘shadowing her 24/7’.

The woman has described Arshid in her interview as a ‘psycho’. 

The body of Barclays worker Ms Dookhran was found in a freezer with her throat slashed after officers prized it open, the court has heard.

Arshid, of Homefield Gardens, Mitcham, denies murder, attempted murder, two counts of rape, sexual assault and assault by penetration.

Tappu, of Spencer Road, Acton, denies kidnap, false imprisonment, and possession of a firearm with intent.

The trial continues.
item.dc:abstract: The surviving victim desperately tried to raise the alarm after Mujahid Arshid (right, a court sketch), 33, kidnapped her and 20-year-old Celine Dookhran (left), the Old Bailey heard. Arshid is accused of murdering Miss Dookhran and stuffing her body inside a chest-high freezer at a disused £1.5million six-bedroom house (inset) he was working at in Kingston-upon-Thames, Surrey. The other woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was allegedly raped and slashed with a knife as Arshid told her: ‘You’ve got ten minutes to live.’
item.dc:creator: Alex Matthews
item.mi:shortTitle: Haunting text 'kidnap victim sent to her mother

item.title: Speeding IT manager who ‘gambled’ on an amber light at a busy junction is jailed for killing a graduate, 25, whose parents drove past the crash scene not knowing their daughter was the victim
item.description: Glenn Wall, 35, was speeding home to get to a family barbecue but failed to brake when he saw a set of lights turning red in Timperley, Greater Manchester, and ploughed into Helena Thurm, 25.
item.content:encoded:
A speeding driver who 'gambled' on an amber light at a busy junction was jailed for two years today after killing a graduate as she crossed the road.

Glenn Wall, 35, was speeding home to get to a family barbecue and failed to brake as he 'gambled' on getting through an amber traffic light in Timperley, Greater Manchester.

The IT manager's Vauxhall Astra car sped across a busy junction at 36mph and ploughed into Helena Thurm, 25, as she was crossing the road after a job interview.

The former grammar school pupil was thrown into the air by the force of the impact and suffered multiple injuries, before dying the following day in hospital.

In a tragic twist, her parents drove past the scene of the collision and saw Wall talking to police at the roadside - but had no idea their daughter was the victim.

Today, the victim's family accused him of using his car like a 'killing machine' and condemned his 'selfish and thoughtless actions to get home quicker through traffic'. 

Inquiries revealed Wall was just a mile from home when he undertook another driver before speeding through the amber light at Timperley at up to 36mph.

He been driving in a lane signposted for left hand turns only - yet he continued straight on and struck Miss Thurm, who believed it had been safe to cross.

Today, Miss Thurm's mother Sandra, 64, said: 'We had driven past the scene of the collision and I could see the defendant talking to the police officer and a paramedic. An hour later we were told that Helena had been hit by a car.

'She was an innocent young woman who happened to be in the wrong place at the wrong time. She had so much to live for and unfulfilled potential. 

'She always used to say that her dream job was to work in marketing and it is even more tragic that she was killed in her way back a job interview that day.

'Helena was starting a new chapter in her life of happiness and promise and she has been deprived of so much.  We have to pass the scene when we leave or arrive home and we can no longer bear to live there as the memories are too painful.

'We have been forced to leave and move elsewhere. As a family we cannot express enough how much trauma this has left us in.'

At Manchester Crown Court in a statement to Wall, Miss Thurm's brother Stephen, 30, said: 'Driving a car is something which some people take all too frivolously and lightly even though it can ultimately be a killing machine.

The former company project manager added: 'Your selfish and thoughtless actions to get home quicker through traffic ended up taking someone's life.

'You may get what I see as a very brief custodial sentence, but my family and I will have a life sentence of loss and grief. Even though you were proven to be at fault it will ultimately be all of our family who pay the much heavier price.

'But the one you should be most repentant to is not here today, Helena, my lovely, wonderful sister. Every day you should ask for her forgiveness.'

Mr Thurm added: 'To me Helena wasn't just my little sister, she was also someone I lived with, worked with and constantly socialised with, and above all she was my best friend and someone who I had looked after since I was just three years old. 

'She was the person in the world who I loved the most and her death has devastated my life. It has broken me and I no longer feel the same person who I was before.

'She was always there for me, she knew me better than anyone else in the world. The bond was irreplaceable and special, I never expected that to be broken and her life to have been ended in such a tragic way at such a young age.

'Since she was killed a year and a half ago I have quit my job due to the grief and I find life a constant depressing struggle and the one person who would most understand my pain and grief, Helena is no longer here to help me through that.'

Wall, who was found guilty of causing death by dangerous driving, showed no emotion as Judge Patrick Field QC also banned him from driving two years which will start when he is freed from jail. 

The judge told Wall: 'The tragedy of what happened on an otherwise unremarkable summers day was palpable to all who have heard the evidence in this case.

'I accept that when you got into your car you had no intention driving dangerously and causing harm to others road users. 

'But you were driving to get home after a day at work for a BBQ with your wife and you approached the traffic lights in the wrong lane.

'When the lights changed to amber you sailed on without slowing. You could have stopped safely at the lights but you decided not to do so. 

'Helena Thurm was there to be seen by you but you failed to spot her and did not adjust your speed accordingly. Your intention throughout this case was to seek to prove that Helena Thurm was to blame.

'I am urged to consider suspending a term of imprisonment but to do so would be wholly inappropriate and whilst there are factors of personal mitigation, appropriate punishment would only be achieved by immediate custody.'

The tragedy occurred on June 20, 2016 after Miss Thurm, a former pupil at Altrincham Grammar School for Girls, who graduated in public relations and digital communications at Manchester Metropolitan University, had attended an job interview at a fashion retailer in the city.

Rob Hall, prosecuting, said: 'Afterwards she phoned her boyfriend and they chatted about how the interview had gone. 

'She had some spare time so went shopping at the Arndale Centre and got her haircut. By 5pm she was getting a tram to get back to Timperley.

'On the way out of Manchester she phoned her father and mother to tell them how the interview went and discussed arrangements for that evening but that would turn out to be their last conversation with their daughter.'

Wall, who worked at an office 25 miles away in Rochdale, had been on his way home to Altrincham when he encountered a set of roadworks at the junction on the A56 Manchester Road at 6.08pm.

Mr Hall added: 'A witness, travelling in the right hand lane and as he approached the traffic lights, noted that the lights were changing to amber so he stopped. 

'But this defendant who in the left hand lane did not take the same approach and he didn't slow.

'His response was to see that as an opportunity to get in front of the witness and he undertook his car and drove straight across the traffic lights where Helena Thurm was crossing - and where she had been waiting for some time.

'When she saw this defendant approaching in a left only lane she would have been entitled to think he would not be travelling straight onwards. 

'But he went straight across the cross roads and drove straight through her throwing her into the air. This defendant was essentially gambling on an amber light.'

Wall denied wrongdoing and claimed he thought Miss Thurm was on her mobile phone at the time of the collision - but examinations showed the device was not being used at the time of the impact.

In mitigation his lawyer Richard Dawson said: 'This is a tragic case and involves a feature regrettably common to this type of incident. This is not a case of sustained bad driving - but a case of flawed decision being taken and ending badly.

'Although this may come as some surprise to the family the defendant has always expressed genuine remorse for his actions on that day. He reflects on this incident everyday and has suffered from panic attacks and flashbacks since the incident.'
item.dc:abstract: Glenn Wall (left, pictured today), 35, was speeding home to get to a family barbecue but failed to brake when 'gambled' on an amber traffic light in Timperley, Greater Manchester. The IT manager's Vauxhall Astra car hurtled across a busy junction and ploughed into Helena Thurm (right; and centre, with her brother Mike) as she was crossing the road following a job interview. The 25-year-old former grammar school pupil was thrown into the air by the force of the impact and suffered multiple injuries, before dying the following day in hospital. In a tragic twist, her parents drove past the scene of the collision and saw Wall talking to police at the roadside - but had no idea their daughter was the victim. Today, the victim's family accused him of using his car like a 'killing machine' and condemned his 'selfish and thoughtless actions to get home quicker through traffic'.
item.dc:creator: Mark Duell
item.mi:shortTitle: 'Selfish' driver who killed graduate is jailed for 2 years

item.title: Manchester City star Kevin De Bruyne is 'excited about the future' as he signs a new contract until 2023
item.description: Kevin De Bruyne has signed a new five-year contract at Manchester City to commit his future to the club until 2023. The Belgium star's deal is worth £280,000-a-week but could rise.
item.content:encoded:
Manchester City have tied talisman Kevin De Bruyne down to a new five-and-a-half-year contract.

De Bruyne agreed terms last week on his £280,000-a-week, which could see him pocket around an additional £70,000 in bonuses.

Murmurs about interest from Real Madrid and Barcelona surfaced, with City moving quickly to complete a deal until 2023, with Brazilian midfielder Fred, 24, edging closer to a move to City from Shakhtar Donetsk.

 ‘It was pretty easy decision,’ said De Bruyne after Monday night’s announcement. ‘Obviously you hear a lot of people talk about other clubs.

‘At the moment we are one of the best clubs in the world. The way this club is working as a whole unit is unbelievable. I’ve never witnessed it like that before. I think maybe the best thing is that I’ve performed well in the big games. Hopefully we can go far in all competitions.’

De Bruyne is settled in Manchester with his wife Michele and son Mason, and wants to give Pep Guardiola his best years.

‘When we came here, Michele was already expecting,’ said the 26-year-old. ‘Everything went so well and the family is very happy. My wife also knows that for us it is the best decision to stay here.’   

He added: 'I am really happy to have signed this new deal. As I've said previously, my intention has always been to stay here at City, where I've felt at home from day one.

'Not only are we winning – we are playing great football. It's a pleasure to be a part of and I'm really excited about what we can achieve in the coming years.'   

De Bruyne has scored 31 goals in 122 games and made 50 assists since joining City for £55million from Wolfsburg in August 2015.

Here to win titles! #KDB2023 pic.twitter.com/P6iRaAz2fz

— Kevin De Bruyne (@DeBruyneKev) January 22, 2018

He added: 'I feel very honoured and blessed that I can go on for the next five and a half years here. I think from the moment I came here I got a lot of support.

'I know a lot of times they sing that song in the games and I feel really appreciated, so hopefully we can have some good times in the next five and a half years.'

The club's director of football Txiki Begiristain said: 'Kevin's new deal is great news for our club.

'He has shown this season how important he is to the team and has been integral in everything we've done so far. 

'We are thrilled he has committed his long-term future to Manchester City.'

De Bruyne becomes the third City player to sign a contract in the last week after Nicolas Otamendi and Fernandinho agreed new terms.
item.dc:abstract: Kevin De Bruyne has signed a new five-year contract at Manchester City to commit his future to the club until 2023. The Belgium star's deal is worth £280,000-a-week but could rise to more than £350,000 with bonuses. De Bruyne has emerged as arguably the best player in the Premier League this season.
item.dc:creator: Ben Church
item.mi:shortTitle: Manchester City star Kevin De Bruyne signs new long-term contract

item.title: 'This isn't a permanent thing': Pregnant Kylie Jenner will return to social media and 'introduce her baby to fans' after giving birth
item.description: She's gone into hiding since her pregnancy was revealed. And according to Entertainment Tonight , Kylie Jenner's absence from social media is not going to be a 'permanent thing.'
item.content:encoded:
She's gone into hiding since her pregnancy was revealed in mid-September.

And according to Entertainment Tonight, Kylie Jenner's absence from social media is not going to be a 'permanent thing.'

The website says that the 20-year-old pregnant star has been really enjoying 'her time away from the spotlight.' 

Kylie, who just had a crib delivered to her home last week, 'will make an announcement and introduce the baby to her fans' once she's born. 

ET's source noted that the Kylie Cosmetics founder 'has been chilling at home for the most part and just living her best life.'

The reality star will also speak out on why she 'went "dark" on social media' and why she took a break from being in the public eye.

She's 'definitely not going to deny that she's had a baby, or continue to evade questions about it all,' the website's source added. 

Kylie, who has managed to stay out of the public eye for months, is expecting a baby girl in March with her boyfriend of eight months, rapper Travis Scott, 25.   

ET's insider said Kylie plans on releasing a photo 'and acknowledging the baby,' adding that 'she's excited to continue to be her authentic self, and that will soon mean being a mother and sharing that with her fans.' 

The site's source said she's 'enjoying' her privacy: it's 'the first time she can remember in her entire life not being followed by cameras.'

Kylie, who is excited about adding mother as part of her identity, will 'most likely' use Instagram to announce her birth, ET reports.

While Kylie and the rest of the Kardashian/Jenner clan have yet to confirm the pregnancy, mother Kris Jenner alluded to it on a recent episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians show.

 Kylie was having problems with a staff member taking photos of her at her home. 

During Keeping Up With The Kardashians, Kris said out loud: 'I really feel bad for Kylie because there's always somebody that's trying to exploit a certain situation.'

Adding:  'To have somebody in her own home trying to snap pictures they shouldn't be snapping is really, really stressful.'  

She continued: 'You want to be able to trust the people that you're surrounded by, but we have to really be on alert at all time, and that's extremely upsetting when you feel like you can't be in your own bedroom or bathroom.' 

Fans immediately took to social media about the Kris' comments, which seemingly refer to Kylie's pregnancy. 

Kylie, who was previously in an on-off relationship with Tyga, has not been seen in public since her pregnancy began showing.

The last time she was spotted in a full body shot was in September, although she was just in the early stages of her pregnancy.

She did attend Kris' annual Christmas party but wasn't pictured in any full body images - just black and white selfies from the photo booth. 

The crib came on the same day her older sister Kim Kardashian revealed she welcomed her third child - a daughter - via surrogate.

Kim and Kanye named their third child Chicago West. 

Earlier this month, rumors swirled that Kylie was in labor and checked into Cedar's Sinai hospital - but that rumor turned out to be false, according to TMZ. 

Her sister Khloe Kardashian is also pregnant; the 33-year-old star revealed the happy news on her Instagram account last month.

Khloe recently just hit the six month mark in her pregnancy; she is set to welcome her first child with her boyfriend, Tristan Thompson. 

In the meantime, Kylie's cosmetics company will be releasing another new product.

The reality star's brand, Kylie's Cosmetics, announced it would be releasing a new set of blue hue eye shadows, entitled Blue Honey, on January 23.

Though fans online have pointed out that the reality star, who ordinarily shows off her cosmetics by trying them out herself on social media, has not yet done so with her latest product.
item.dc:abstract: She's gone into hiding since her pregnancy was revealed in mid-September. And according to Entertainment Tonight , Kylie Jenner's absence from social media is not going to be a 'permanent thing.' The website says that the 20-year-old, who is expecting her first child - a baby girl, with rapper Travis Scott, has been really enjoying 'her time away from the spotlight.'
item.dc:creator: Sarah Sotoodeh
item.mi:shortTitle: Pregnant Kylie Jenner will return to social media after giving birth

item.title: Willow Smith, 17, joins model of the moment Winnie Harlow and catwalk queen Naomi Campbell at star-studded Christian Dior Paris Haute Couture Fashion Week presentation
item.description: Willow Smith rivalled Naomi Campbell and Winnie Harlow on the style front as they arrived to the photocall for Christian Dior Haute Couture S/S18 collection during Paris Fashion Week.
item.content:encoded:
One is a multi-talented rising star while the others are world famous models who regularly make their mark in the fashion world. 

And Willow Smith certainly rivalled Naomi Campbell and Winnie Harlow on the style front as they arrived to the photocall for the eagerly-anticipated Christian Dior Haute Couture Spring/Summer 2018 collection during Paris Fashion Week on Monday.

Willow, 17, looked every inch the trendy teen in a chic blazer and flowing skirt, while Naomi, 47 and Winnie, 23, proved flawless in their showstopping looks as they posed up a storm.

Scroll down for video   

Willow, the daughter of Will and Jada Pinkett Smith, stuck to her signature sense of style as she rocked up to the event in the sleeveless button-down waistcoat. 

The Whip My Hair singer teamed the number with a stylish skirt which effortlessly caught the wind as she made her way to the venue in a pair of sky-high black heels. 

Known for her quirky statements, Willow spruced up the look with a heavy white eye-liner, which made her brown eyes pop. 

Willow, who is an actress and a singer, took a break from her hectic schedule as she greeted fans while leaving her hotel. 

Meanwhile, iconic supermodel Naomi stunned in her flowing semi-sheer gown which boasted a thin nude belt across her midriff to showcase her enviable statistics.

She added to the sartorially savvy look with a tweed a-line navy coat which features a gold and black brooch for a slight element of prep.

Embracing Parisian chic, Naomi tamed her straight raven tresses in place with a chic black baker boy cap with a fascinator style net. 

A pair of oversized shades rested on her youthful features as she effortlessly worked her angles for the style extravaganza.   

Meanwhile, Winnie - who was discovered on America's Next Top Model - rivalled Naomi on the style front, as she oozed androgynous chic in her look. 

The social media savvy star flashed a glimpse of her black lace bra with a saucily unbuttoned white shirt which was neatly tucked into a pair of high-waisted navy trousers. 

Showcasing her style credentials, the star - who has the skin condition vitiligo - teamed the look with a cape style blazer, which showed off her gold watch and bracelets.

Winnie kept with the gold theme with her safety-pin style earrings and kooky vintage sunnies, while the rest of her locks were piled into an immaculate bun. 

The highly awaited show also brought out an array fashion's finest, including Alexa Chung who rocked her flair for fashion in a figure-skimming polka playsuit. 

Her tiny waist was emphasised with a thin black belt and she wore tights over her slim legs, while sticking to pair of flat black shoes. 

Relying on her natural features, Alexa sported blush-infused cheeks which complemented her casually unkempt shoulder length brunette mane.

Actress Emily Blunt looked sensational as she brought a pop of colour to the event with her red printed dress. She swept her tresses into a casual bun, with a few loose tendrils framing her gorgeous porcelain features.  

Eva Herzigova lived up to her supermodel status as she arrived in a sensational navy skirt and matching jacket which was effortlessly draped off her shoulders.

Erin O'Connor looked fabulous as she wrapped up in a chunky black waist-cinching jacket and sensational baker boy cap.

The iconic model draped a statement bag over her shoulders and opted for a pair of shiny black shoes with a star print design. 

Italian actress Monica Bellucci, 53, put on an incredibly youthful, age-defying display as she arrived in a clingy black dress and towering heels. The plunging element of Monica's number put all focus on her busty assets. 

Arizona Muse lived up to her last name in a gorgeous red dress which flattered her slender frame effortlessly.

British beauty Gemma Arterton stood out from the crown in a waist-cinching brown plaid dress, which she teamed with a natural make-up look. Fashion muses Annabelle Wallis, Chiara Ferragni, and Haley Bennett were dressed to impress.

Russian model Sasha Pivovarova opted for bohemian vibes with her heavily encrusted nude-coloured gown, which was teamed with a camel coloured cape. 

Fellow high-profile model Natalia Vodianova looked regal in a figure-hugging satin slip dress and belted coat, and she added some drama with a slick of hot pink lipstick.  

Actress Clotilde Courau oozed glamour as she exhibited her sensational decolletage in an off-the-shoulder black tiered dress. 

The Dior runway proved to be a truly spectacular feast for the eyes, with eye-catching garments focusing on neutral monochrome hues - all serving to accentuate a woman's physique. 

While many looks - designed by Maria Grazia Chiuri - proved to be simple and understated in design, others featured commanding patterns and detailing. 

Structured masks where also propped on the models to give the overall collection a more distinct edge. The show was inevitably met by a rapturous applause by spectators.

And Willow Smith certainly rivalled Naomi Campbell and Winnie Harlow on the style front as they arrived to the photocall for the eagerly-anticipated Christian Dior Haute Couture S/S18 collection during Paris Fashion Week on Monday. Willow, 17, looked every inch the trendy teen in a chic blazer and flowing skirt, while Naomi, 47 and Winnie, 23, proved flawless in their showstopping looks as they posed up a storm.

item.title: Surfer is barely visible as he takes on giant wall of water off the coast of Portugal... but stuns the crowd by catching the wave PERFECTLY
item.description: The Nazaré coast of Portugal is home to some of the world's biggest waves - and fearless Sebastian Steudtner caught one perfectly, giving a masterclass in big wave surfing.
item.content:encoded:
The coast of Portugal is home to some of the world's biggest waves - and fearless Sebastian Steudtner caught one perfectly, giving a masterclass in big wave surfing.

Gripping footage shows the daredevil dwarfed by the towering roller as he skirts along underneath it. 

A crowd looks on from the the shore, in awe at his performance.

The 32-year-old looks in total control throughout the clip, shot from the Nazaré shoreline in the Silver Coast area of Portugal. 

The son of a German and Austrian, Sebastian Steudtner grew up in Nuremberg in northern Bavaria, Germany.

His first taste of surfing came at nine when he took up boogie boarding on a trip to France.

In 2001, the then 16-year-old went to the Hawaiian island of Maui when he began a career as a professional wind surfer.  

Without a steady source of income from windsurfing Steudtner looked around for work, spending time in construction as he developed a passion for big wave surfing.

In December 15, 2004, he met a personal goal and took on the world's largest wave - the Peahi off the north coast of the island. That day waves were nearly 70 feet tall. 

The next year he conquered Teahupoo, a wave situated off Tahiti and the most dangerous in the world.

The daredevil surfer is also a Laueres Sport for Good Ambassador and implements surf therapy for young people from difficult circumstances in Germany.

item.title: Now THAT'S high-speed rail! 1,500 Chinese workers build railway for a new train station in just NINE HOURS
item.description: Seven trains and 23 diggers were used to assist the massive project for a new train station in southern China. The workers also installed traffic lights and traffic monitoring equipment.
item.content:encoded:
Chinese workers have demonstrated their incredible efficiency yet again.

Around 1,500 workers spent just nine hours paving the railway for a new train station in Fujian Province, southern China.

Seven trains and 23 diggers were used to assist the massive project, according to a supervisor. 

An aerial video released by Pear shows how the construction workers connected three major railroads - the Ganlong Railway, Ganruilong Railway and Zhanglong Railway - with the new Nanlong Railway.

They also installed the traffic signals and a series of traffic monitoring equipment. 

The construction took place at the Nanlong Railway Station in the city of Longyan according Xinhua News Agency. 

It began on January 19 and finished in the wee hours of January 20, said the report. 

The project was finished so quickly because the workers had been arranged into seven units to tackle different tasks simultaneously, said Zhan Daosong, a deputy manager at China Tiesiju Civil Engineering Group, the country's main railroad builder.

The construction of the Nanlong Railway is ongoing and is expected to complete at the end of 2018.

Measuring 246 kilometres (152 miles) in length, the railway is due to be a main transport link between south-east China and central China, Xinhua reported.

The railway would be able to support trains which operate at a maximum speed of 200kmh (124 mph), according to reports.
item.dc:abstract: Around 1,500 workers spent just nine hours paving the railway for a new train station in Fujian Province, southern China. Seven trains and 23 diggers were used to assist the massive project, according to a supervisor. An aerial video released by Pear shows how the construction workers connected three major railroads - the Ganlong Railway, Ganruilong Railway and Zhanglong Railway - with the new Nanlong Railway.

item.title: Throwback image of Alexis Sanchez wearing a Manchester United tracksuit jacket emerges after star seals transfer
item.description: Alexis Sanchez said he dreamed of playing for Manchester United as a young lad after finalising his switch to Old Trafford and his claim of adoring the Red Devils has been backed up.
item.content:encoded:
Alexis Sanchez said he dreamed of playing for Manchester United as a young lad after finalising his switch to Old Trafford and his claim of adoring the Red Devils has been backed up. 

An image of a young Sanchez donning a Manchester United tracksuit jacket emerged on social media hours after his long-awaited transfer was announced. 

Twitter user Poets Corner tweeted the picture of Sanchez posing next to a friend while wearing a white top with the Red Devils badge embroidered on it.

Enjoy your night pic.twitter.com/D09j5tspH0

— Poets Corner (@PoetsCornerUK) January 22, 2018

Sanchez had claimed in his first interview as a Manchester United player that he always admired the club and even spoke to former boss Sir Alex Ferguson over the possibility of playing under the legendary manager.  

The 29-year-old attacker said on his arrival at Old Trafford after swapping places with Henrikh Mkhitaryan: 'Since I was a young lad I've always said that my dream was to play for Manchester United, and I'm not just saying that because I'm here now and today it's come true. 

'I always said as a kid that I'd like to play for United and I once spoke to Sir Alex Ferguson about it.

'We chatted for around 20 minutes. And I told him that my dream was to come here to Manchester United. It really is a massive club, very powerful, and so now, when I got the opportunity to come here, I looked at the badge and my hairs just stood up on end because it's a powerful club and the biggest in England.'

Sanchez had been expected to seal a move to the blue half of Manchester at the start of the window after going close to teaming back up with Pep Guardiola in the summer. 

However City decided against breaking their wage structure to sign Sanchez which allowed rivals United to swoop on the Chile star. 

Sanchez, who is expected to train with his new team-mates for the first time on Tuesday, could make his United debut against Yeovil Town on Friday evening. 

Jose Mourinho's new signing is available to represent United in the FA Cup as he missed Arsenal's 4-2 defeat by Nottingham Forest in the third round.

If Sanchez does not make an appearance then his debut could come in the Premier League against Tottenham on January 31.
item.dc:abstract: Alexis Sanchez said he dreamed of playing for Manchester United as a young lad after finalising his switch to Old Trafford and his claim of adoring the Red Devils has been backed up. An image of a young Sanchez donning a Manchester United tracksuit jacket emerged on social media hours after his long-awaited transfer was announced. Sanchez is pictured next to a friend while wearing a white top with the Red Devils badge embroidered on it.

item.title: Cold case breakthrough: Possible GRAVE SITE for the three missing Beaumont children identified 52 years after they vanished in Australia's most notorious unsolved crime
item.description: Police will return to a factory at Plympton in South Australia in the coming weeks after fresh information from witnesses and results of tests on the land suggest the missing children are buried there.
item.content:encoded:
A possible grave site for the three missing Beaumont children, who disappeared almost 52 years ago has been uncovered.

Jane, nine, Arnna, seven, and Grant, four, Beaumont disappeared from Glenelg Beach, Adelaide, on Australia Day 1966, never to be seen again despite a major manhunt and one of the nation's biggest ever police investigations. 

Over half a century later, a renewed interest in the case has uncovered a site in south east Adelaide where the children may have been buried.

A spokesperson from South Australia Police told Daily Mail Australia results of investigations into land and fresh information from witnesses has led police to examine a new part of the new Castalloy factory in Plympton.

Scroll down for video

The land was searched in 2013, but only a small part of it, and the new search will take place at the back of the plot.

Tests using state of the art machinery revealed a plot of disturbed land on the factory property, measuring about one metre wide, two metres long and two metres deep - the size of a grave,Seven News reported.

Harry Phipps, a deceased Adelaide businessman who was implicated in a book written about the case, The Satin Man, has returned to the forefront of the investigation as a possible suspect, Nine News reported.

He was not named, though enough information was contained in the book for him to be easily identified by those who knew him. 

The book alleged he had killed the children and two other men had dug a large hole on the grounds of the factory to bury them in.

Today Tonight named him at the time in a report about the book's contents.

The two men first came forward after images of Mr Phipps were used during a television broadcast.

They told police they had been asked to dig the trench, but neither of them were there when police began to excavate a very small section of the property. 

'He was a paedophile, he was a predatorial [sic] paedophile and he was a dangerous man, we know that,' Bill Hayes, a former detective for SA Police told Seven News. 

In 2013, Mr Phipps was not a suspect in the case. Major Crime detectives said at the time allegations which implicated him had been investigated and officers chose to leave them.   

Mr Phipps' estranged son Haydn had earlier claimed to author Alan Whiticker he saw Jane, Arnna and Grant in their backyard in Glenlg on the same day they vanished.

He further claimed his father buried them in the sand pit at the factory, which Mr Phipps owned.    

Police say they do not yet have a confirmed date for the excavation, but are expected to begin work in the next few weeks. 

Daily Mail Australia has contacted South Australia Police for further comment.
item.dc:abstract: Police will return to the New Castalloy factory at Plympton (top right) in suburban Adelaide in the coming weeks after fresh information from witnesses and results of tests on the land suggest the three missing Beaumont children are buried there. Jane (main right), Arnna (main left), and Grant (main centre) Beaumont disappeared from Glenelg beach in Adelaide on Australia Day 1966, never to be seen again despite a major manhunt and one of the nation's biggest ever police investigations. Police excavated a small part of the factory land in 2013 (top right) after a book was published claiming the children were buried there, but nothing was found. The new search will examine a different part of the land, at the rear of the property. This new information brings deceased Adelaide businessman, Harry Phipps (bottom right), back to the centre of the investigation as a suspect. Mr Phipps allegedly had two men dig a hole the size of a grave at the factory, which he owned at the time. Mr Phipps was the character alluded to in The Satin Man – a book written about the investigation into the missing children. He was named by Today Tonight after the book was published, but remained unnamed in the book.
item.dc:creator: Brianne Tolj

item.title: Arsenal's Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang talks hit stumbling block as Borussia Dortmund insist replacement is signed BEFORE sanctioning £53m move
item.description: Arsenal's move for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has hit a stumbling block after Borussia Dortmund insisted they would not let the striker leave without having a replacement lined-up.
item.content:encoded:
Arsenal's move for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has hit a stumbling block after Borussia Dortmund insisted they would not let the striker leave without having a replacement lined-up. 

Arsenal chief executive Ivan Gazidis and head of recruitment Sven Mislintat have flown to Germany in an effort to complete their swoop for the 28-year-old striker.

The Gunners have already had a £43million offer for Aubameyang rejected, though Arsenal will return with a improved offer. But Dortmund are driving a hard bargain. 

Firstly, they want a minimum of £53million for the striker - a fee that would break Arsenal's transfer record currently held by summer signing Alexandre Lacazette.

Perhaps more pertinently, the Bundesliga side want to complete the signing of Aubameyang's replacement before allowing their star striker to leave. 

Arsenal remain confident of sealing a deal this month - but Dortmund's stance is proving problematic at this stage. Conveniently, their first-choice target for a replacement is Arsenal's out-of-favour star Olivier Giroud.

The Frenchman has fallen down the pecking order under Arsene Wenger and is keen to seal a move this month in order to improve his chances of making the World Cup in Russia. 

Dortmund's hard-line stance could be a means to ensure the Gunners include the France international as a makeweight in the transfer, but at this stage both clubs are looking to negotiate two separate deals.

Head coach Peter Stoger said he was hoping for a conclusion to the saga within the next 24 hours, but could not guarantee anything.

'Of course, we'd like there to be a resolution tomorrow (Tuesday), whatever it was,' said Stoger.

'Everything that is clarified does everyone good in their lives. But if it takes longer then it will take longer.

'I cannot say if anything will happen in the next few days.'

Arsenal got one of their main pieces of business done on Monday evening when Henrikh Mkhitaryan completed his move from Manchester United. 

The Armenian overtook Lacazette and Mesut Ozil as the club's top earners on a deal worth just over £170,000-per-week.

However, Aubameyang's contract will eclipse close pal Mkhitaryan if his attempts to engineer a move to Arsenal are successful with the African set to earn in the region of £190,000-per-week at the Emirates.
item.dc:abstract: Arsenal's move for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has hit a stumbling block after Borussia Dortmund insisted they would not let the striker leave without having a replacement lined-up. Arsenal chief executive Ivan Gazidis and head of recruitment Sven Mislintat have flown to Germany in an effort to complete their swoop for the 28-year-old striker. The Gunners have already had a £43million offer for Aubameyang rejected, though Arsenal will return with a improved offer. But Dortmund are driving a hard bargain.

item.title: Super mom! Blac Chyna showcases curvaceous figure in tight athletic gear as she plants post workout kiss on one-year-old daughter Dream
item.description: She is in the midst of a messy legal battle with the Kardashians. And Blac Chyna needed to blow off some steam as she was spotted vigorously working out in Los Angeles on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
She is in the midst of a messy legal battle with the Kardashians.

And Blac Chyna needed to blow off some steam as she was spotted vigorously working out in Los Angeles on Sunday. 

The 29-year-old cut a curvy figure as she rocked black athletic gear before planting a kiss on one-year-old daughter Dream - whom she shares with Rob Kardashian. 

Scroll down for video 

Daring to impress, the fashion enthusiast showcased her ample assets in a body hugging fitness ensemble.

She wore a waist trainer that gave her the coveted hour glass figure as she jogged throughout the neighborhood.

Her toned physique was highlighted in the sports bra and tight leggings as she pushed herself to the limit.

Later, Blac Chyna performed push ups in the park against a table to prove her athletic prowess.

Dream enjoyed a leisurely day at the playground as she worked the swing set. 

Meanwhile, Blac Chyna is in the midst of a legal battle with her former sister-in-law Kim Kardashian following the cancellation of her reality show Rob & Chyna.  

She has been locked in a bitter legal battle with the famous family since the latter end of last year.

However she's seemingly keen to bury the hatchet following the arrival of their daughter earlier this week as she said they 'deserve' to receive a 'blessing.'

Speaking to The Blast, Chyna said of the news while flashing a beaming smile: 'It's always a blessing. They deserve blessings.'

Chyna's kind words come just days after Kim, Rob and their mother Kris Jenner hit back at the former stripper after she claimed in a lawsuit - filed originally in October last year - that they had defamed her and sabotaged her show.

The celebrity trio - who are named as the defendants in the suit - have countered Chyna's claims by saying they are 'bald conclusions that have no factual support.'

However, Chyna is said to be fuming according to TMZ, after the Kardashian clan asked the judge to toss the case because they said she is responsible for the cancellation after she got a restraining order against Rob.

TMZ's insider says that Chyna is mad because she thinks women shouldn't lose jobs because of trying to protect her and her family from violence, adding that she had 'fears' for her and daughter Dream's safety.

The former stripper, who claims Rob abused her, thinks the Kardashian clan are sending a bad message to women who get domestic violence restraining orders.

However, after Rob agreed to pay her $20,000 monthly in child support for their daughter Dream, Chyna dropped the restraining order; which shows she didn't really feel threatened, according to TMZ via a Kardashian source.

The Kardashians, according to TMZ's report from Wednesday, claim that the former exotic dancer is the only party responsible for the Rob & Chyna show cancellation.

Their reasoning is that when she filed for the restraining order against Rob, it made it impossible to shoot any scenes of her with Rob.

According to Chyna - whose real name is Angela White - the US TV network E!, the show's production team and Rob were all open to shooting a second season before it was suddenly cut, and she believes the trio were responsible for the cancellation.

Chyna - who also has five-year-old son King Cairo with her ex-fiance Tyga - has also accused the Kardashians of defamation, after they alleged that she left Dream at home while she went to a party, but the Kardashians insist they never made that claim.

Rob and Chyna started dating in January 2016 - the same they got engaged and also welcomed their daughter Dream, now 13 months. They were on-off until they broke off their relationship in February 2017.
item.dc:abstract: She is in the midst of a messy legal battle with the Kardashians. And Blac Chyna needed to blow off some steam as she was spotted vigorously working out in Los Angeles on Sunday. The 29-year-old cut a curvy figure as she rocked black athletic gear before planting a kiss on one-year-old daughter Dream - whom she shares with Rob Kardashian.

item.title: PICTURED: Disgraced Dance Moms star Abby Lee Miller shows off her 100lb weight loss in prison as she prepares for early release
item.description: News that Abby Lee Miller has been scheduled for early release from California prison for good behavior isn't the only thing going well for the Dance Moms alum.
item.content:encoded:
News that Abby Lee Miller has been scheduled for early release from California prison for good behavior isn't the only thing going well for the Dance Moms alum.

The criminal choreographer is said to have slimmed down quite a bit during her stay, shedding a whopping 100lbs according to Entertainment Tonight.

The Lifetime reality figure, 51, gave the public of glimpse of her new figure in a grateful Instagram post shared on social media Sunday.

Abby, who began her sentence at Federal Correctional Complex in Victorville, California July, 12 2017, opened up about her experience behind bars in a lengthy caption accompanying a picture of her visit from several of her Dance Moms costars.

The dance instructor began on a reflective note: 'Sometimes in life you make mistakes I trusted the wrong people and didn’t pay any attention to things I should of. I’m more than sorry for the mistakes I have made.

'My world flipped upside down when I had to enter prison. I did so with grace, the stories you read about me been a princess are untrue.'

She continued: 'I have made friends with both inmates and staff, I’ve tried to better myself, participated in anything offered to me and I am a better person for this experience.'

She was cautious about word of an early release, writing: 'All the press stories and speculation are not entirely correct however, I am feeling hopeful but no dates have been confirmed at this time.'

'I am feeling great and ready to turn over a new leaf thank you so much to everyone for your support especially my nearest and dearest I love you all ( and yes this is me in prison.)'

Abby Lee was sentenced to 366 day prison sentence after being charged for fraud.   

But on Friday Deadline reported the Dance Moms star will be released early for good behavior.

The star will be a free woman on February 20, according to the site. That means she is serving less than half of her sentence.

After she leaves prison she will check into a halfway house in Van Nuys, California. 

This comes just over five months after Miller started serving her year and one day sentenced.  

In May, she was found guilty of bankruptcy fraud for attempting to hide $775,000 of income from Dance Moms, its spin-off Abby’s Ultimate Dance Competition and multiple other projects during Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. 

She was indicted on 20 counts of fraud in October 2015, and entered a guilty plea on June 27, 2016.  

Miller was originally ordered to turn herself in on June 30, but the date was pushed back.

In addition to serving time, Chief Judge Joy Flowers Conti also ordered Abby to pay a $40,000 fine and serve two years probation after her time behind bars.

In August Miller sat down for an interview where she said she didn't think she would do well behind bars.

The TV standout made the admission during an interview with The View.

The icon, who taped the segment in mid July, said: 'I probably won’t survive.' She is serving out a 366 day term. 

'I made lots of mistakes,' the TV icon said.

But she added that she did help out a lot of young dancers on her reality TV series. 'I gave kids a new life. No one can take away from me. No one,' she said. 

Abby told Entertainment Tonight recently that Lifetime TV cameras will be there. The cable channel is behind her series Dance Moms.

The reality TV star said, 'It wasn't important to me, it was important to them. I signed a four-year contract.'  

TMZ has been sharing reports of what the star is eating in prison.

Abby's breakfast consists of whole wheat bread with jelly, hot grits, fruit and a cup of skim milk, the site claimed.

For lunch, Abby and the rest of the inmates at the California prison get a burger with either french fries or a baked potato, as well as some fruit.

The website reported that dinner will be bean soup with a potato salad and either a hummus wrap or a deli sandwich.

TMZ added that weekends at the all women's federal prison includes chicken tacos and Sloppy Joes. 

She can also buy  Top Ramen noodles, Spam and Hot & Spicy pork skin chips at the shop. There is also cola, cookies 'n cream ice cream and canned albacore tuna. 

It was also reported that she trained for two months with a law enforcement official on how to act in prison. 

'Abby was told to follow orders and get in tight with correction officers in order to score better job assignments,' a source told TMZ.
item.dc:abstract: News that Abby Lee Miller has been scheduled for early release from California prison for good behavior isn't the only thing going well for the Dance Moms alum. The criminal choreographer is said to have slimmed down quite a bit during her stay, shedding a whopping 100lbs according to Entertainment Tonight.

item.title: 'People stare at me everywhere I go': Mother, 61, who was savaged by a neighbour's dog says her deep facial scars will never heal – and she is yet to get a penny in compensation
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Sylvia Baillie, 61, from Paisley, was attacked by the Japanese Akita at a neighbour's flat in July 2016, leaving flaps of skin 'dangling' from her badly injured face.
item.content:encoded:
A mother who was savaged by a vicious dog says the attack has left her with deep scars that will never heal - and not a penny in compensation. 

Sylvia Baillie, 61, from Paisley, was attacked by the Japanese Akita at a neighbour's flat in July 2016, leaving flaps of skin 'dangling' from her face and her brother unable to recognise who she was. 

Ms Baillie says she still has flashbacks of the moment the dog sunk its fangs into her face and is too tramautised to leave home by herself. 

'I feel like everybody stares at me everywhere I go,' she told The Daily Record. 'In the cold, my skin flares up, it goes purple and then you can see the scars.

'I have to drink through a straw — even tea and coffee. I was always out on the town. Now I never leave the flat on my own.'

Owners Leeanne McHugh, then 36, and Patrick Maher, then 46, were each jailed for 12 months for the attack.

In February, they each admitted a charge under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991 - that they were in charge of a dog that was dangerously out of control and left its victim scarred for life. 

They had invited Ms Baillee back to their flat after driving her to a friend's funeral. When Ms Baillee left to leave, the dog savaged her cheek. 

McHugh and Maher did nothing to help and the dog only let go when Ms Baillee's daughter Leanne, 38, wrestled it off. 

Maher got another four-month sentence for terrorising Ms Baillee and flashing her after the attack.

McHugh was ordered to pay £1,000 compensation but the victim has not received any of this. 

Ms Baillee spent four days in hospital after the attack during which she went through emergency surgery.  

'My own brother couldn't recognise me at the hospital, I had flaps of skin dangling from my face,' she said.  

'I used to love dogs and kept Labradors when my daughter was younger. But now I can't even look at them. I can't even visit family if they have pets.

'I suffer panic attacks, graphic flashbacks and am forced relive it all over again.'

item.title: Jennifer Lopez flaunts toned midriff in cropped sweater as she leaves swanky Bel-Air hotel with lover Alex Rodriguez
item.description: JLo was snapped leaving the tony resort with the former Yankees star on Monday as the couple hopped into their red Rolls Royce Convertible and headed off.
item.content:encoded:
She put on a sexy performance on stage in Los Angeles on Saturday as she performed at Calibash.

But later Jennifer Lopez enjoyed some down time with her beau Alex Rodriguez in one of the world's most exclusive hotels - the Bel-Air in Beverly Hills.

JLo was snapped leaving the tony resort with the former Yankees star on Monday as the couple hopped into their red Rolls Royce Convertible and headed off. 

The pop superstar, 48, showed off her toned midriff in a cropped turtleneck sweater paired with skintight black leggings.

She added a pair of shearling-lined boots, enormous hoop earrings and aviator shades.

Rodriguez, 42, was dressed in blue jeans with a white shirt and a denim jacket.

He checked his phone for messages before getting behind the wheel and driving the two of them away.

Jennifer and A-Rod have been going strong ever since they went public with their romance in March 2017.

They have been virtually inseparable ever since and enjoy spending time together with their children from previous marriages.

JLo shares nine-year-old twins, daughter Emme and son Maximilian, with her ex-husband Marc Anthony, while  Rodriguez shares daughters Ella, nine, and Natasha, 13. with ex-wife Cynthia Scurtis.

item.title: Shakira 'could face JAIL or forced to pay back several millions from her earnings after being targeted in Spanish tax evasion inquiry'
item.description: Colombian singer Shakira has reportedly been accused of tax evasion.
item.content:encoded:
Colombian singer Shakira has reportedly been accused of tax evasion and could even face jail.

Spanish tax authorities have asked prosecutors to look into the 40-year-old's financial affairs over the four years between 2011 and 2014 after claiming she could have evaded paying the proper taxes.

Spain's Tax Agency has argued Shakira was living in Spain during that period and therefore should have paid income tax on her worldwide earnings and not just earnings obtained in Spain, respected Catalan daily La Vanguardia reported. 

Scroll down for video 

State prosecution chiefs will now have to determine whether they agree with the Tax Agency - and if so, launch formal legal proceedings.

Sources close to Shakira, who became a full tax resident in Spain in 2015, told La Vanguardia she had always met her tax obligations and was ready to abide by the 'economic consequences' of what they considered could be simple differences in 'evaluation criteria' rather than a deliberate attempt to evade taxes.

The Catalan paper reported Spanish prosecutors could go after Shakira for 'several dozen million euros' if they agreed with the tax authorities' take on the situation and could even demand a possible prison sentence.

The singer's tax experts are expected to insist she was in Spain less than 183 days for the years in question - and so was not required to pay wealth tax on her worldwide assets as well as her earnings in Spain.

Shakira was named in the recent Paradise Papers scandal after it was revealed late last year she transferred £30million in musical rights to an offshore firm in Malta.

Her lawyer Ezequiel Camerini told Spanish news website El Confidencial the singer lived in Barcelona - but quoted him as justifying her links to a tax haven on the basis that 'as an international artist, she had lived in several places in the course of her professional life, acting in total accordance with the laws of all the jurisdictions she resides in.'

Shakira, full name Shakira Isabel Mebarak Ripoll, separated from Antonio de la Rua, son of a former Argentinian president, in August 2010 before starting a relationship with Barcelona footballer Gerard Pique in 2011.

They have two children Milan, who turned five on Monday, and Sasha, who will turn four at the end of January. 

MailOnline has contacted a spokesperson for Shakira for comment.
item.dc:abstract: Colombian singer Shakira has reportedly been accused of tax evasion. Spanish tax authorities have asked prosecutors to look into the 40-year-old's financial affairs over the four years between 2011 and 2014 after claiming she could have evaded paying the proper taxes. Spain's Tax Agency has argued Shakira was living in Spain during that period and therefore should have paid income tax on her worldwide earnings and not just earnings obtained in Spain, respected Catalan daily La Vanguardia reported.

item.title: Age-defying Monica Bellucci, 53, displays her eye-popping cleavage in curve-hugging gown as she makes an entrance at Dior runway show for Paris Fashion Week
item.description: Monica Belluci, 53, looked sensational as ever at the Christian Dior Haute Couture Spring/Summer 2018 show as part of Paris Fashion Week on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
She began her climb to stardom modelling for fashion heavyweights Dolce and Gabbana and Dior.

And Italian actress Monica Bellucci, 53, returned to where it all began - and looking as sensational as ever at the Christian Dior Haute Couture Spring/Summer 2018 show as part of Paris Fashion Week on Monday. 

The age-defying model proved her catwalk prowess in a stunning black ensemble that showed off her head-turning physique flawlessly. 

Scroll down for video 

The Matrix star exuded glamour as she poured her hour-glass figure into a low-cut black mid-length dress, with a dangerously low neckline to showcase her ample cleavage. 

The plunging neckline gave a saucy glimpse at her lacy black lingerie, which drew the attention towards her busty frame.

Monica slipped into sophisticated black tights and a pair of sky-scraper heels as she paraded the jaw-dropping monochrome Dior venue in the French capital. 

She carried her worldly possessions in a polished black faux-snake skin bag with an edgy silver strap, offsetting the minimalist colour scheme. 

Letting her curvaceous figure do all the talking, the Spectre Bond girl added a tiny touch of shimmer to her matte look, with a delicate silver necklace as her only accessory.

A smokey eye and a nude rose glossy lip further accentuated Monica's natural beauty, with her cropped raven tresses hanging neatly down onto her shoulders, framing her face perfectly. 

Despite the black and white colour scheme for the event, Monica did anything but fade into the background, catching all the attention while sitting in the front row of the decadent fashion show.

Showing off her incredible figure, it is easy to wonder how they stay in such great shape. In an interview with the Daily Telegraph newspaper in May, she said that she doesn't favour the gym in a quest to stay slim, instead preferring to enjoy life and eat pasta and cake.

Monica explained: 'I’m not someone who wakes up at 6am to go to the gym. The truth is that I like cakes and pasta, the odd glass of wine and a very occasional cigarette. My advice is: eat well, drink well, have good sex – and laugh a lot. The rest comes all on its own.' 

Monica has be rubbing shoulders with the creme-de-la-creme of the fashion elite while enjoying the high-paced couture season. 

She continued to turned heads on Monday night as she rubbed shoulders with Diane Kruger and Marian Cotillard at the star-studded Cesar - Revelations 2018 party in Paris the week before. 

Choosing for the versatile black once again, paring a dazzling black suit with Louboutin heels and a quilted shoulder bag.

item.title: Hollywood's oldest working actress Connie Sawyer dies at 105 at her LA area home... after career that nearly spanned NINE DECADES
item.description: Sawyer spent more than 87 years in show business, as she began her career as a teen, and got cast in a number of memorable TV and films over the years.
item.content:encoded:
Connie Sawyer, a woman hailed as the oldest working actress in Hollywood, has died at 105.

Sawyer died at her home in Woodland Hills Monday.

Sawyer spent more than 87 years in show business, as she began her career as a teen, and got cast in a number of memorable TV and films over the years.

Scroll below for video 

Sawyer - who was born in Pueblo, Colorado on November 27, 1912 -  began performing vaudeville at the age of 18, according to Deadline.

Her TV resume reads like a Who's Who of the genre, as shows she appeared on included 60s classics such as The Fugitive, The Andy Griffith Show and Bonanza; 70s staples such as All in the Family, The Mary Tyler Moore Show, Kojak, Welcome Back, Kotter and Starsky & Hutch; 80s programs such as Laverne & Shirley, Silver Spoons and Dynasty; 90s shows like Seinfeld, Home Improvement and ER; and recent era shows including Ray Donovan, 2 Broke Girls and The Office.

Among the notable motion pictures she appeared in included 1979's ...And Justice For All, 1989's When Harry Met Sally..., 2008's Pineapple Express and 1994's Dumb and Dumber, in which her character had a memorable exchange with Jim Carrey's Lloyd Christmas.

Speaking with People to commemorate her 105th birthday this past November, Sawyer attributed her longevity to an active lifestyle.

She said, 'There aren’t that many people around who are 105. I always say you have to move, you have to get off the couch. I used to swim, play golf, tap dance, line dance - I was always moving and I was lucky.'

She noted that both of her parents 'lived a long time,' adding, 'Papa died at 91 and my mama was 89, so I had good genes too. That’s the reason.'

She told the magazine that she was very engaged in activities at the communal home she lived at for the Motion Picture & Television Fund’s retired workers. She said, 'I go to exercise class, I go to all the parties that they throw, I go to all the dinners, I go to all the shows.'

She was the oldest working person with membership in the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, and approached her duties in a 'very serious' manner.

'Sometimes I’ll see movies twice to make sure I want to vote for them,' she said.

She told the magazine that her advice to aspiring entertainers was to 'never, never give up.

'I never gave up,' she said. 'Hang in there, do the work and eventually it will come to you.'

The entertainer is survived by her two daughters Lisa Dudley and Julie Watkins; four grandkids, named Sam Dudley, Hannah Stubblefield and Emily and Carrie Watkins and three great-grandkids, named Adam, Sebastian and Maya, Deadline reported.
item.dc:abstract: Connie Sawyer, a woman hailed as the oldest working actress in Hollywood, has died at 105. Sawyer died at her home in Woodland Hills Monday, and it was not immediately clear what caused her passing. Sawyer spent more than 87 years in show business, as she began her career as a teen, and got cast in a number of memorable TV and films over the years.
item.dc:creator: Christine Rendon
item.mi:shortTitle: Hollywood's oldest working actress Connie Sawyer dies at 105 at home
